post_text: Welcome to a new school year! Our staff have been busy preparing for students to return and planning for a great year, despite the many challenges we face. Butler’s Bus Company has asked us to remind you that students will be picked up in the mornings at about the same time as previous years, although those times will most likely change once we know which students are actually riding the buses. For the first few days it will be helpful to have students at the bus stop at least 5 minutes early so that the driver knows to stop for them. If you have questions about busing, please call Butlers at 754-6508. All students will need a daily health check ticket and a mask to ride the bus. If you haven't received daily health check tickets yet, please contact your school. We’d also like to remind you that K-12 schools will be dismissed an hour early the first 4 days of school, and preschool will be dismissed at noon on those first 4 days. Thank-you so much for partnering with us as we reopen schools.

GREAT STUDENT NEWS:
Lake Region Student Makes Community Outreach to Albany Preschool

The Albany Preschool raised funds to purchase Strider Bikes for its students. However, after receiving them, they realized that they could not use them due to the spokes being exposed. Lake Region Union High School Senior, Joel Devereux, decided to dedicate his Community Service time to complete this project. Joel collaborated with VOC Agriculture Teacher, Tim Byrne and Librarian, Faith Lucas to create custom wheel covers that could be used to cover the spokes. He programed the CNC machine in Lake Region’s Woodworking Department to cut wheel covers out of corrugated plastic sheets. Joel and Ms. Lucas delivered the 8 Strider Bikes to Albany Preschool on September 26th, 2019 to 20 excited Preschoolers.
